intro: Hieracium kirunense, commonly known as Kirunense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are basal and form a rosette, while its flowering stems bear yellow ray flowers. Hieracium kirunense is often found in rocky or gravelly areas and is adapted to cold climates.
